text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm gonna show
you how to make a simple but delicious
cranberry tart couldn't be easier to
make takes just a few ingredients and
this is a great dessert that you can use
on your Thanksgiving table this year let
me take you over the ingredients before
we get started you're gonna need some
fresh cranberries some granulated sugar
some orange juice some water unsalted
butter a little bit of flour some orange
zest and you're going to also need a
9-inch pie crust that I have just put
into a 9 inch tart pan with a removable
bottom now I have a recipe on my website
if you want to use if you want to make
your own basic pie crust which this is
what it is it's a basic pie crust or you
can buy at the store I know around this
time of year things like pie crusts are
super cheap because you know everyone's
baking and of course the holiday season
so stock up keep it in the freezer for
whenever you need it now I absolutely
love cranberries I love that they're
tart I love that dirt kind of chewy in a
way and when you cook them down they
become really thick and delicious and
it's gonna go perfect with the pie crust
so first thing you wanna do is get your
oven hot to 400 get that ready it's like
a thing you wanna do is prep your pie
crust in your little tart pan and I'm
gonna put it I put it on a baking sheet
that's lined with aluminum foil just in
case any juices were to spill over it's
one less things for me to clean up so
with that done let's go to the stove so
we can cook up our cranberries I have a
saucepan over medium-high heat I'm just
gonna add in my cranberries my water my
freshly squeezed orange juice with a
little bit of pulp in there just totally
fine and the orange zest I'm gonna bring
this up to a boil and I'm gonna let this
cook for about three minutes or so or
until the cranberry start popping my
cranberries look perfect they're all
just about pop I'm gonna turn this down
now to about medium-low I'm gonna add in
my sugar looks like a lot of sugar but
that's because cranberries are very very
tart and they really do need it give
that a stir
I'm also gonna add in a touch of flour
perfect crank the heat back up to medium
and let this cook for about a minute or
so or until it's nice and thick my
cranberry mixture looks perfect I'm
going to add now a little bit of butter
just to make it really creamy and kind
of luxurious I like to use that word
makes me feel fancy stir that in because
the cranberry mixture is so hot it's
going to easily melt the butter in no
time which it has so now you're just
gonna put this into our tart pan and as
you can see it's not like a whole line
makes just a very thin layer but that's
what you want because cranberries are so
tart that it would be completely
overpowering if you had any more mixture
than this and besides this is a really
nice thin crispy tart and once we dust
it with confectioner sugar it's just
delicious and looks beautiful so now I'm
just going to make this nice and even
always even as I can make it and I'm
gonna put this into the oven 400 degrees
for about 35 to 40 minutes or until the
mixture is nice and bubbly and the crust
is a beautiful golden brown color and
then we're gonna let it cool completely
before I show you how to serve it after
baking and letting my tart cool
completely so now I can handle it and
it's so easy right and now I'm just
gonna take it out you're gonna put this
on a little fall inspired there it goes
and that's so pretty now we are going to
cover this with confectioner sugar just
because I want to look at that oh that's
just gorgeous have some of the red
peeking out and that's just time to cut
in the cranberry mixture has gone almost
jammy like it's almost like a jam tart
but with cranberries I'm telling you
it's so good
couldn't be easier you can make this on
a weeknight if you've got friends coming
around and you just don't know what to
do if you have some pie crusts on hand
and a bag of cranberries you're good to
go but this is also a great addition to
your Thanksgiving table of course it
tastes so much better than you can
imagine
and I mean um mmm wow that's that I
don't know what to say it's good
it's dotard it's not overly sweet at all
so if you are having quite a few of
really sweet things on your dessert
table for Thanksgiving this is a great
addition that if someone that doesn't
like super sweet things will go crazy
for that's it I hope you enjoy spending
time with me to get this recipe another
is good WWWE to calm now see you next
